channel.title: STAT 140-04: Introduction to the Ideas and Applications of Statistics on Stat 140 (Fall 2020)
channel.description: Recent content in STAT 140-04: Introduction to the Ideas and Applications of Statistics on Stat 140 (Fall 2020)

item.title: Office hours
item.description: Office hours schedule Below is a calendar with office hours. You can directly add these events to your own Google Calendar. You can join virtual office hours by adding the event to your own calendar. These office hours are only for those officially enrolled in the course. Teaching team Instructor Shan Shan (she/her) Assistant Professor Department of Math and Statistics Mount Holyoke College email: sshan at mtholyoke dot edu website: https://sshanshans.

item.title: Schedule
item.description:
Course Map Daily schedule Note: This schedule may be updated as the module progresses. Due dates for the homework and project will not be changed.
Week Date Lesson Reading Slides Tutorials DC HW Project Week 01 Wed, Oct 21 Welcome to Statistics and Data Science Thur, Oct 22 Data basics Fri, Oct 23 Statistics to illuminate Week 02 Mon, Oct 26 Categorical variable: barplot Tue, Oct 27 Categorical variable: relationship Wed, Oct 28 Numerical variable: histogram shape and summary Thur, Oct 29 Numerical variable: robust statistics Fir, Oct30 Putting it all together Week 03 Mon, Nov 02 Numerical variable: relationship Tue, Nov 03 Election day (no class) Wed, Nov 04 Linear model (last day to withdraw without a W) Thur, Nov 05 How well does a linear model fit Fir, Nov 06 Linear regression condition Week 04 Mon, Nov 09 Randomness and sampling overview Tue, Nov 10 Experiments and observational studies Wed, Nov 11 Sampling distribution Thur, Nov 12 Normal model Fir, Nov 13 Central limit theorem Week 05 Mon, Nov 16 Confidence interval Tue, Nov 17 Interpretation of confidence interval Wed, Nov 18 One proportion Thur, Nov 19 Comparing two proportions Fir, Nov 20 Bootstrapping method Week 06 Mon, Nov 23 Proposal presentation Tue, Nov 24 Proposal presentation Week 07 Mon, Nov 30 Hypothesis testing Tue, Dec 01 P-value Wed, Dec 02 Compute P-value with R Thur, Dec 03 Decision making with hypothesis testing Fir, Dec 04 Hypothesis testing examples Week 08 Mon, Dec 07 Inference for regression Tue, Dec 08 Inference for regression Wed, Dec 09 Speaker and writer's workshop Thur, Dec 10 Group presentation Fir, Dec 11 Group presentation

item.title: Syllabus
item.description: Inclusion & Accessibility This course is designed to be welcoming and accessible to all students. It is my goal for our learning environment to facilitate learning and intellectual development for everyone. If something was said in class (by anyone) that made you feel uncomfortable, or if there is some aspect of class that is not welcoming or accessible to you, please let me know immediately. Academic Accommodations AccessAbility Services is the office on campus that determines academic accommodations for students with disabilities.

item.title: Tips and Help
item.description: Logistics How can I succeed in this class? How I should ask for TAs to help me debug the code? R related How to Install R on Windows, Mac OS X, and Ubuntu? Imposter syndrome Why some of my classmates just got the concept/did the programming assignment so fast? Am I not good enough? Q: How can I succeed in this class? [Adapted from Albert Kim]
